'''Lumbi''' was a castle that was built in [[Aman]] to be the third dwelling place of [[Melkor|Melko]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name=Lum>{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''1''', pp. 278-9</ref>

==History==
After Melko was overthrown by [[Tulkas]] in the [[battle of the Silent Pools|battle]] of the [[Aelin-uial|Silent Pools]] during the [[War of Wrath|First Farthing Forth]], the castle of Lumbi was used to imprison him after he was bound and chained. Lumbi was guarded by [[Gorgumoth]], the [[Hounds|hound]] of [[Mandos]].<ref name=Lum/>

At some unknown time after, [[Tevildo]] gnawed on Melko's bonds until eventually, many centuries later, Melko was released from his imprisonment. After which, Melko was pursued up the [[Pine of Tavrobel]] by [[Telimektar]].<ref name=pine>{{LT2|VI}}, p. 281</ref>

==Etymology==
The name ''Lumbi'' is in [[Qenya]], probably being derived from the root ''[[LUVU]]'' ("dark weather")<ref>''[[Qenya Lexicon]]'', p. 57</ref> and has the same meaning as its [[Gnomish]] cognate<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-690952759.html|articlename=ᴱQ. ''Lumbi'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=10 May 2022}}</ref> '''''Lumfod''''', meaning "gloomy-end" or "Gloomy End"<ref>''Gnomish Lexicon'', pg. 55</ref>, from ''[[lum]]'' ("cloud")<ref>{{PE|11}}, p. 55</ref> + ''[[fod]]'' ("end, butt, bottom")<ref>{{PE|11}}, p. 35</ref>. '''''Lumfad''''' was either an early spelling or a variation of ''Lumfod''.<ref name=Lum/>
